name: Mercury
overview: Mercury is the smallest planet and closest to the Sun, with a barren, rocky surface.
structure: Mercury has a large metallic core, making up about 85% of the planet's radius.
geology: Its surface is covered with craters, old lava plains, and rocky ridges.

name: Venus
overview: Venus is the second planet from the Sun, known for its thick, toxic atmosphere and bright appearance.
structure: It has a rocky surface and a hot, molten metal core beneath a dense atmosphere.
geology: Venus has vast volcanic plains, mountain ranges, and surface deformations.

name: Earth
overview: Earth is our home and the only planet known to support life, with a balanced climate and diverse ecosystems.
structure: The Earth is composed of a solid inner core, liquid outer core, mantle, and crust.
geology: Earth's surface features mountains, oceans, forests, deserts, and tectonic activity.

name: Mars
overview: Mars is known as the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance from iron oxide dust.
structure: Mars has a rocky core, a thin mantle, and a surface covered in volcanic and tectonic features.
geology: It hosts Olympus Mons, the largest volcano, and Valles Marineris, a vast canyon system.

name: Jupiter
overview: Jupiter is the largest planet in the solar system, known for its Great Red Spot and many moons.
structure: It is a gas giant with a possible solid core surrounded by metallic hydrogen and thick clouds.
geology: Although it lacks a solid surface, it features massive storms and colorful cloud bands.

name: Saturn
overview: Saturn is famous for its stunning ring system, composed of ice and rock particles.
structure: A gas giant with a small core, it is mostly hydrogen and helium in fluid and gaseous form.
geology: Saturn has no solid ground but features extreme wind speeds and ring-related phenomena.

name: Uranus
overview: Uranus is an ice giant with a tilted axis, making it roll around the Sun on its side.
structure: It has an icy mantle surrounding a rocky core, with a hydrogen-rich atmosphere.
geology: Cloud bands, storms, and faint rings mark the planet's upper atmosphere and icy clouds.

name: Neptune
overview: Neptune is the most distant planet, known for its deep blue color and fast winds.
structure: It has a rocky core surrounded by icy water, ammonia, and methane layers.
geology: Neptune's atmosphere shows dark storms, high-speed winds, and faint ring arcs.
